title: About
text: Hey! My name is Logan Young-Glenn and I am a student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am currently a junior, with a major in Sports Media and Communications in the College of Journalism. A few interesting things about me are that I grew up in Lincoln and I have worked at the Country Club of Lincoln as a player services member over the past three years.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Logan Young-Glenn's Sports Data Site
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(gt)
library(wehoop)


logs <- read_csv("http://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/logs24.csv")

Rows: 11907 Columns: 48
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr   (8): Season, TeamFull, Opponent, HomeAway, W_L, URL, Conference, Team
dbl  (39): Game, TeamScore, OpponentScore, TeamFG, TeamFGA, TeamFGPCT, Team3...
date  (1): Date

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



head(logs)

# A tibble: 6 × 48
  Season     Game Date       TeamFull          Opponent HomeAway W_L   TeamScore
  <chr>     <dbl> <date>     <chr>             <chr>    <chr>    <chr>     <dbl>
1 2023-2024     1 2023-11-06 Abilene Christia… Oklahom… @        W            64
2 2023-2024     2 2023-11-10 Abilene Christia… NC State @        L            64
3 2023-2024     3 2023-11-14 Abilene Christia… Prairie… <NA>     L            74
4 2023-2024     4 2023-11-17 Abilene Christia… San Jos… N        W            77
5 2023-2024     5 2023-11-19 Abilene Christia… Fordham  N        W            59
6 2023-2024     6 2023-11-20 Abilene Christia… Missour… N        L            69
# ℹ 40 more variables: OpponentScore <dbl>, TeamFG <dbl>, TeamFGA <dbl>,
#   TeamFGPCT <dbl>, Team3P <dbl>, Team3PA <dbl>, Team3PPCT <dbl>,
#   TeamFT <dbl>, TeamFTA <dbl>, TeamFTPCT <dbl>, TeamOffRebounds <dbl>,
#   TeamTotalRebounds <dbl>, TeamAssists <dbl>, TeamSteals <dbl>,
#   TeamBlocks <dbl>, TeamTurnovers <dbl>, TeamPersonalFouls <dbl>,
#   OpponentFG <dbl>, OpponentFGA <dbl>, OpponentFGPCT <dbl>, Opponent3P <dbl>,
#   Opponent3PA <dbl>, Opponent3PPCT <dbl>, OpponentFT <dbl>, …



big <- c("Nebraska", "Iowa", "San Diego State", "Illinois", "Wisconsin", "Michigan", "Michigan St", "Ohio State", "Purdue", "Indiana", "Maryland", "Rutgers", "Penn State", "Northwestern")


sweet <- c("Uconn", "Iowa State", "North Carolina", "Alabama", "Arizona", "Baylor", "Purdue", "Gonzaga", "Creighton", "Marquette", "Duke")

bigmbb <- logs |> 
  filter(Team %in% sweet)|>
  select(Team, TeamFG, TeamFGA, Team3P, Team3PA) |>
  group_by(Team) |>
  summarize(
    TotalFG = sum(TeamFG),
    TotalFGA = sum(TeamFGA),
    Total3P = sum(Team3P),
    Total3PA = sum(Team3PA)
  )|>
  mutate(FGPct = TotalFG/TotalFGA, ThreePct = Total3P/Total3PA) |>
  select(Team, Total3P, Total3PA, ThreePct) |>
  arrange(desc(ThreePct)) 


bigmbb |> gt() |>
  cols_label(
    Team = "Team",
    Total3P = "Threes Made",
    Total3PA = "Threes Attempted",
    ThreePct = "Percentage"
  )|>
  tab_header(
    title = "The Best Deep Shot Making Teams Remaining in the NCAA Tournament",
    subtitle = "The Boilermakers lead the pact in percentage while the Crimson Tide hold onto the most threes made!"
  )|>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Logan Young-Glenn  |  **Source:** [logs24](http://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/logs24.csv)")
  )  |>
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  )|>
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#373A36"),
      cell_text(color = "#CEB888")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Team == "Purdue")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#828A8F"),
      cell_text(color = "#9E1B32")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Team == "Alabama")
  )








The Best Deep Shot Making Teams Remaining in the NCAA Tournament


The Boilermakers lead the pact in percentage while the Crimson Tide hold onto the most threes made!

title: Did Virginia Deserve to Make the 2024 NCAA Tournament?
text:
just want to see if this is working for the website!

title: Did the Virginia Cavaliers Deserve to Make the 2024 NCAA Tournament?
text:
This is a test to see if i can type in this jit


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(gt)
library(ggrepel)

net <- read_csv("netwl.csv")


Rows: 100 Columns: 14
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (10): SCHOOL, CONFERENCE, RECORD, ROAD, NEUTRAL, HOME, QUAD 1, QUAD 2, Q...
dbl  (4): RANK, PREVIOUS, QUAD 1+2 W, QUAD 3+4 L

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
kenpom <- read_csv("kenpomwl.csv")


New names:
Rows: 100 Columns: 22
── Column specification
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
(2): Team, Conf dbl (20): Rk, W, L, AdjEM...6, AdjO, ...8, AdjD, ...10, AdjT,
...12, Luck, ....
ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...6`
• `` -> `...8`
• `` -> `...10`
• `` -> `...12`
• `` -> `...14`
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...15`
• `` -> `...16`
• `` -> `...18`
• `` -> `...20`
• `AdjEM` -> `AdjEM...21`
• `` -> `...22`


Code
teams <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")

tourneyteam <- c("Virginia","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")

nontourneyteam <- c("Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblet <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% teams) 

madeit <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% tourneyteam)

nitbound <- kenpom |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( Team %in% nontourneyteam)

vi <- kenpom |>
  filter( Team == "Virginia")

ggplot() +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=vi, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#F84C1E",
                      alpha = 1) +
  scale_size(range = c(5, 10), name="Adjusted Efficiency") +
  geom_point(data=nitbound, aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, size= AdjEM...6),
             color="#009CDE",
                      alpha = 1)  +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=nitbound,
    aes(x=AdjO, y=AdjD, label=Team)) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=vi,aes(x=AdjO + .2, y=AdjD, label=Team)
  ) +
  labs(x="Offensive Efficiency", y="Defensive Efficiency", title="Adjusted Efficiency Between Virginia and Non Tournament Teams", subtitle="Look where Virginia falls amongst these teams in terms of efficiency!", caption="Source: Kenpom | By Logan Young-Glenn") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text( size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )


Scale for size is already present.
Adding another scale for size, which will replace the existing scale.











Code
net <- read_csv("net2024.csv")


Rows: 100 Columns: 14
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (10): SCHOOL, CONFERENCE, RECORD, ROAD, NEUTRAL, HOME, QUAD 1, QUAD 2, Q...
dbl  (4): RANK, PREVIOUS, GOODWINS, BADLOSSES

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
head(net)


# A tibble: 6 × 14
   RANK PREVIOUS SCHOOL  CONFERENCE RECORD ROAD  NEUTRAL HOME  `QUAD 1` `QUAD 2`
  <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr> <chr>    <chr>   
1     1        1 Houston Big 12     30-4   7-3   6-1     17-0  16-4     3-0     
2     2        2 UConn   Big East   31-3   9-3   6-0     16-0  13-3     8-0     
3     3        3 Purdue  Big Ten    29-4   7-3   6-1     16-0  12-4     8-0     
4     4        4 Arizona Pac-12     25-8   7-4   3-3     15-1  8-3      7-4     
5     5        5 Auburn  SEC        27-7   5-5   7-1     15-1  3-7      10-0    
6     6        6 Iowa S… Big 12     27-7   5-5   4-2     18-0  10-6     6-1     
# ℹ 4 more variables: GOODWINS <dbl>, `QUAD 3` <chr>, `QUAD 4` <chr>,
#   BADLOSSES <dbl>


Code
school <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana St.","Cincinatti","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall","Colorado St.","Nevada","Boise St.","Colorado")

bubbles <- net |>
  arrange(RANK) |>
  filter( SCHOOL %in% school)

vc <- net |>
  filter( SCHOOL == "Virginia")

winslosses <- bubbles |>
  group_by(SCHOOL) |>
  mutate(
    seasongoodwins = GOODWINS,
    seasonbadlosses = BADLOSSES
 )

bc <- winslosses |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols=starts_with("season"), 
    names_to="Outcome", 
    values_to="winsandlosses")

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=bc, aes(x=SCHOOL, weight=winsandlosses, fill=Outcome)) + 
  coord_flip()









Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=bc, aes(x=reorder(SCHOOL, winsandlosses), weight=winsandlosses, fill=Outcome)) + 
  coord_flip()











Code
library(wehoop)
sportsref <- read_csv("sportsref.csv")


Rows: 362 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): School
dbl (28): Rk, G, W, L, W-L%, SRS, SOS, Conf. W, Conf. L, Home W, Home L, Awa...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
head(sportsref)


# A tibble: 6 × 29
     Rk School             G     W     L `W-L%`    SRS   SOS `Conf. W` `Conf. L`
  <dbl> <chr>          <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
1     1 Abilene Chris…    34    16    18  0.471  -4.12 -1.12        10        10
2     2 Air Force         31     9    22  0.29   -4.77  1.43         2        16
3     3 Akron             35    24    11  0.686   2.77 -2.08        13         5
4     4 Alabama           37    25    12  0.676  20.7  11.8         13         5
5     5 Alabama A&M       35    12    23  0.343 -14.4  -7.52         9         9
6     6 Alabama State     32    13    19  0.406 -11.7  -6.87         8        10

#   `Away L` <dbl>, `Points Tm.` <dbl>, `Points Opp.` <dbl>, Pace <dbl>,

#   `ORB%` <dbl>, `FT/FGA` <dbl>


Code
schoolsr <- c("Virginia","Pittsburgh","Wake Forest","Villanova","Indiana State","Cincinnati","Oklahoma","St. John's (NY)","Seton Hall", "Providence")

bubblesr <- sportsref |>
  arrange(Rk) |>
  filter( School %in% schoolsr)

head(bubblesr)


# A tibble: 6 × 29
     Rk School     G     W     L `W-L%`   SRS   SOS `Conf. W` `Conf. L` `Home W`
  <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
1    51 Cinci…    37    22    15  0.595  15.1  8.49         7        11       16
2   123 India…    39    32     7  0.821  13.4  2.26        17         3       16
3   224 Oklah…    32    20    12  0.625  14.7  8.07         8        10       14
4   235 Pitts…    33    22    11  0.667  14.9  6.92        12         8       13
5   241 Provi…    35    21    14  0.6    12.6  8.93        10        10       14
6   268 Seton…    37    25    12  0.676  12.7  8.8         13         7       17
# ℹ 18 more variables: `Home L` <dbl>, `Away W` <dbl>, `Away L` <dbl>,
#   `Points Tm.` <dbl>, `Points Opp.` <dbl>, Pace <dbl>, ORtg <dbl>, FTr <dbl>,
#   `3PAr` <dbl>, `TS%` <dbl>, `TRB%` <dbl>, `AST%` <dbl>, `STL%` <dbl>,
#   `BLK%` <dbl>, `eFG%` <dbl>, `TOV%` <dbl>, `ORB%` <dbl>, `FT/FGA` <dbl>


Code
bigmbb <- sportsref |> 
  filter(School %in% bubblesr)|>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  group_by(School) |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS)) 

tbl <- bubblesr |>
  select(School, SRS, SOS, W, L) |>
  mutate_at(vars(-School), as.numeric) |>
  arrange(desc(SRS))

 tbl |> gt() |>
  cols_label(
    School = "Team",
    SRS = "Simple Rating",
    SOS = "Schedule Strength",
    W = "Wins",
    L = "Losses"
  )|>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Logan Young-Glenn  |  **Source:** [Sports Reference](https://www.sports-reference.com/cbb/seasons/men/2024-advanced-school-stats.html)")
  )|>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=14)
     )
   )|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "#232D4B"),
      cell_text(color = "#F84C1E")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = School == "Virginia")
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How Does Virginia Compare to Teams That Did Not Make the Tournament?",
    subtitle = "The Cavaliers are dead last in simple rating compared to these teams on the opposite side of the bubble! Virginia's strength of schedule is also not a standout amongst the group. "
  )

title: Introduction
text: Hey! My name is Logan Young-Glenn and I am a student at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am currently a junior, with a major in Sports Media and Communications in the College of Journalism. A few interesting things about me are that I grew up in Lincoln and I have worked at the Country Club of Lincoln as a player services member over the past three years.

title: Latest posts
text:
Did the Virginia Cavaliers Deserve to Make the 2024 NCAA Tournament?














Apr 14, 2024


Logan Young-Glenn
